hanzi-su-wiki:
杯

Значения

Рюмка, бокал, чашечка для сакэ

Мнемоника

Деревянная 木 чашка, содержимое которой принято осушать, чтобы в ней ничего не 不 оставалось бы.

Варианты

盃
purpleculture_pinyin:
bēi
cup; trophy cup; classifier for certain containers of liquids: glass, cup
чашка; трофейный кубок; классификатор для определенных емкостей с жидкостями: стакан, стакан

purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 不 indicates the sound; 木 (tree) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
世界杯 [ shì jiè bēi ]: World Cup
酒杯 [ jiǔ bēi ]: wine cup
茶杯 [ chá bēi ]: teacup; tea-glass; cup; mug; Classifiers: 只
奖杯 [ jiǎng bēi ]: trophy cup
举杯 [ jǔ bēi ]: to toast sb (with wine etc); to drink a toast
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 不 [ bù ] no, not, un-; negative prefix
heisig_chinese_memo: The maple tree is very negative about it, but the farmer still collects cups of maple syrup from it and the tree goes 'NOOOO!'.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: counter for cupfuls, wine glass, glass, toast
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: счетчик для полных кружек, вино, стекло, тосты
koohiiStory1: The maple tree is very negative about it, but the farmer still collects cupfuls of maple syrup from it.
koohiiStory2: A few cupfuls of sake can create a very negative situation. Like smashing into that tree...　　RTK2:　ハイ　一杯　いっぱい(one cupful).
jp_example_words:
杯(さかずき): wine cups
乾杯(かんぱい): toast (drink)
WaniKani_Kanji_Meaning: Cup Of Liquid, Counter For Cups
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A tree is not a cup of liquid or a counter for cups. Don’t get them mixed up. The last time you tried making a cup out of a tree to count your throat got filled with splinters when you used it. There wasn't even any liquid in it.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine cutting a tree into a cup of liquid and focus on the pain in your throat when you try to actually use it. Instead you kick the tree and angrily count cups of liquid in your head, because they simply are NOT the same.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Another way to remember the counter for cups using a cup of liquid would be by creating and memorizing a haiku (はい) about them. Aren’t haikus useful?
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Think of a haiku about a cup of liquid and a counter for cups. Use that haiku to help remember this kanji.
Ru_Meaning: counter for cupfuls, wine glass, glass, toast
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, ノ, 木 (дерево), 礼 (этикет)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: it's not (不) a tree (木), it's a cup
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: No other dish is like those golden trophy cups.
origin_of_ch_char_book: The king and the aristocrats used a huge bronze cauldron for ceremonies. To have a cracked or deformed cauldron was considered to be very bad luck. Since the bronze cauldron was sacred, if it were ruined, they would have shouted “Bu (no) !” and this became the origin of the meaning of the word today as “no” or “forbidden” (不, bu, no; not). The original shape of this character was the ceremonial cup (杯, bei, cup) with three legs which were distorted. The three legs represent ‘Heaven, Human, Earth’, and the distortion of these three legs means ‘bad luck’, ‘evil’. It was not easy to make a model of bronzeware with mud or wax. When the model for molding was deformed, people thought it was the sign of evil.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " wood ", " no " sound, ancient soup and wine pouring device, also written as " cup ". "Said Wen": "Cup, 㔶 also. From the wood to no sound. 𠥧, Leiwen cup." "Ji Yun. "Gray rhyme": "Cup, today's drinker. Or make a cup." "Said Wen Tong Xun Ding Sheng. "Yibu": "Cup, ancient Shenggeng, if it is a device for injecting wine, is commonly called Cup." "Zhuangzi·Xiaoyaoyou": "Cover a cup of water on the col hall, then the mustard is a boat; Glue, the water is shallow but the boat is big."

" Cup " can mean rings, such as "trophies" and "silver cups." It can also be used as a measure word, such as "Mencius·Gaozi Shang": "If you are benevolent today, you can save a car with a glass of water. ."
humanum_short_description_en: From " wood ", " no " sound, ancient soup and wine pouring device.
humanum_full_description:
從「木」，「不」聲，古代盛羹及注酒器，亦寫作「桮」。《說文》：「桮，㔶也。從木否聲。𠥧，籒文桮。」《集韻．灰韻》︰「桮，今飲器。或作杯。」《說文通訓定聲．頤部》︰「桮，古盛羹若注酒之器，通名為杯也。」《莊子‧逍遙游》：「覆杯水於坳堂之上，則芥為之舟；置杯焉則膠，水淺而舟大也。」

　　「杯」可表示環狀物，如「獎杯」、「銀杯」，也可用作量詞，如《孟子‧告子上》：「今之為仁者，猶以一杯水救一車薪之火也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「木」，「不」聲，古代盛羹及注酒器。

Since the bronze cauldron was sacred, if it were ruined, they would have shouted “Bu (no) !” and this became the origin of the meaning of the word today as “no” or “forbidden” (不, bu, no; not). The original shape of this character was the ceremonial cup (杯, bei, cup) with three legs which were distorted. The three legs represent ‘Heaven, Human, Earth’, and the distortion of these three legs means ‘bad luck’, ‘evil’. It was not easy to make a model of bronzeware with mud or wax. When the model for molding was deformed, people thought it was the sign of evil.

從「 木 」，「 不 」聲，古代盛羹及注酒器，亦寫作「 桮 」。《說文》：「桮，㔶也。從木否聲。𠥧，籒文桮。」《集韻．灰韻》︰「桮，今飲器。或作杯。」《說文通訓定聲．頤部》︰「桮，古盛羹若注酒之器，通名為杯也。」《莊子‧逍遙游》：「覆杯水於坳堂之上，則芥為之舟；置杯焉則膠，水淺而舟大也。」 「 杯 」可表示環狀物，如「獎杯」、「銀杯」，也可用作量詞，如《孟子‧告子上》：「今之為仁者，猶以一杯水救一車薪之火也。」
From " wood", " no" sound, ancient soup and wine pouring device, also written as " cup". "Said Wen": "Cup, 㔶 also. From the wood to no sound. 𠥧, Leiwen cup." "Ji Yun. "Gray rhyme": "Cup, today's drinker. Or make a cup." "Said Wen Tong Xun Ding Sheng. "Yibu": "Cup, ancient Shenggeng, if it is a device for injecting wine, is commonly called Cup." "Zhuangzi·Xiaoyaoyou": "Cover a cup of water on the col hall, then the mustard is a boat; Glue, the water is shallow but the boat is big." " Cup" can mean rings, such as "trophies" and "silver cups." It can also be used as a measure word, such as "Mencius·Gaozi Shang": "If you are benevolent today, you can save a car with a glass of water. ."

杯字的基本解释

杯
bēi
盛酒、水、茶等的器皿：杯子。杯盘狼藉。杯中物（指酒）。
杯状的锦标：奖杯。杯赛。夺杯。

杯字的汉语字典释义

[①]［bēi］
［《廣韻》布回切，平灰，幫。］
亦作“柸1”。亦作“桮1”。“棓4”的被通假字。亦作“盃1”。
(1)古代盛羹及注酒之器。
(2)指酒。
(3)引申为酌，饮。
(4)杯状物。
(5)量词。
(6)晋宋间有禅僧常乘木杯渡水，人称杯渡和尚，后因以杯借指舟船。
(7)通“秠”。麸皮。

杯字的英文翻译

◎ 杯
cup, trophy

杯字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　杯； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页513第09
〔古文〕?【唐韻】布回切【集韻】【韻會】晡枚切【正韻】晡回切，?背平聲。【說文】作桮。俗作㮎，通作杯。飮酒器。唐孔穎達曰：《周禮》有王敦，今之杯盂也。【禮·玉藻】母沒而杯棬不能飮焉，口澤之氣存焉爾。　又盛羹器。【前漢·項羽傳】幸分我一杯羹。【師古註】今之側杯有兩耳者。　又叶博孤切，音餔。【曹植·隴西行】卻略再拜跪，然後持一杯。談笑未及竟，左顧敕中廚。　又叶薄侯切，音裒。【鮑照·合歡詩】飮共連理杯，寢共無縫裯。

考證：〔【史記·項羽傳】一杯羹。【師古註】今之側杯有兩耳者。〕　謹按師古註係前漢書，謹將史記改爲前漢。幷照原文增幸分我三字。
杯字的源字形

杯字的起名意思

：盛酒、水、茶等的器皿；也指奖杯。

cup
Name meaning
: Utensils for wine, water, tea, etc.; also refers to trophies.
会意字。篆书从木,古时有些杯是木制的;从否。隶、楷书从木、从不。否和不都表否定,表示杯只盛液体不盛固体食物。
本义指盛羹或注酒的器皿。今泛指盛液体的器。

杯
bēi
杨「杯|杯
ト→J T/ /L な,u1 Ir
Зная слово.
Надпись на печати сделана из дерева, в древности некоторые чашки делали из дерева, никогда.
Ли, обычный сценарий из дерева, никогда.
И нет, и нет - отрицательные значения, что означает, что в чашке содержится только жидкая, а не твердая пища.
Первоначальное значение относится к сосуду для супа или вина.
Сегодня относится к сосуду, содержащему жидкость.
① Посуда для жидкостей, таких как вино, вода, чай: ~ "вино ~ | лифт ~". 2 приза в форме чашки: награда ~ "золото ~" серебро ~.
~ Ge ~ Pan ~ Zi ~ Bow Snake Shadow ~ Pan Chaos ~ Shui Che Xin Cha ~ Dry ~ Quantity ~ Touch ~ Burn ~ Jade ~ Remnant ~ Cold Sunburn
чашка
Ян "Кубок | Кубок
ト → JT / / L な, u1 Ir
bēi
чашка; чайная чашка; винная чарка, кубок; рюмка (также счётное слово)
茶杯 чайная чашка
酒杯 винный бокал, кубок, рюмка
杯茗候叙 жду Ваших сообщений (речей) за чашкой чая (формула приглашения)
高脚杯 фужер
杯状细胞 биол. бокаловидная клетка
三杯绍酒 три рюмки шаосинского (рисового) вина
戴维斯杯 Кубок Дэвиса
Radicals: 木, 不  (tree, not)
Meaning Mnemonic
A tree is not a cup of liquid or a counter for cups. Don’t get them mixed up. The last time you tried making a cup out of a tree to count your throat got filled with splinters when you used it. There wasn't even any liquid in it.
Imagine cutting a tree into a cup of liquid and focus on the pain in your throat when you try to actually use it. Instead you kick the tree and angrily count cups of liquid in your head, because they simply are NOT the same.
Reading Mnemonic
Another way to remember the counter for cups using a cup of liquid would be by creating and memorizing a haiku (はい) about them. Aren’t haikus useful?
Think of a haiku about a cup of liquid and a counter for cups. Use that haiku to help remember this kanji.
